forms.document_type: New patient registration packet with billing-only release clause
Patient Bill of Rights and Responsibilities

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: No online records request form or process exists; patients must call or visit in person to initiate a request.

red_flags: No ROI or records request form published online — patients cannot initiate access from the website
Patient rights documents state the right to access records but provide no mechanism to exercise it
No submission pathway (fax, email, mail address) documented for records requests
bright_spots: Notice of Privacy Practices is written in clear, plain language following the HHS model template
NPP includes explicit substance abuse treatment records protection statement
EPIC/MyChart patient portal (via OCHIN) exists as a potential alternative access pathway

findability.rationale: Level 1: Effectively unfindable online — exhaustive search including five Google queries, full sitemap analysis, URL guessing, and Wayback Machine review found no ROI form; none has ever been published on this domain.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 1: No usable digital form exists for records requests; the organization publishes no ROI form in any format, so there is no digital workflow to evaluate.

content_design.rationale: Level 2: No actual ROI form exists to evaluate; the NPP describes rights clearly but the 'Ask us how to do this' guidance is confusing and unhelpful for a patient trying to request records, with no actionable next steps provided.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 1: No process for patient self-access exists online; rights are stated in informational documents but no form, instructions, or pathway is provided, effectively obstructing patient access from the website.

compliance.rationale: Level 2: The NPP correctly states 30-day response time and cost-based fees, but the complete absence of any accessible request mechanism creates a practical barrier that likely exceeds what is permissible under HIPAA's Right of Access provisions.

overall.summary: Franklin Primary Health Center publishes no records request form online and provides no digital pathway for patients to exercise their HIPAA Right of Access, earning a failing grade despite competent informational documents.
